title: Information regarding Charity Commission communications with SCC

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide copies of  all written communications received by Sheffield City Council from the Charity Commission dated between January 2005 and the present.
Yours faithfully,
Russell Johnson

Dear Russell Johnson,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Charity Commission
correspondence which we received on 12/09/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 10/10/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,

Dear Mr Johnson
We apologise for missing our deadline of 9 October 2023 for your request
of 8 September 2023, regarding correspondence from the Charity Commission
since 2005. We thank you for your chasers of 13 October 2023 and 8
November 2023.
Our initial search indicated that we held 2,659 items (2.06GB) which may
be in scope: emails sent to or received from @charitycommission.gov.uk
(and not including print letters that may have been sent by snail mail.)
However, your request was only for correspondence received from the
Charity Commission, so we need to re-run our search to determine whether
the request is likely to fall within – or without – the cost of
compliance.
We are undertaking this presently and will update you at the soonest
opportunity.
We thank you for your patience.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Dear Mr Johnson
We sincerely apologise for missing our deadline of 10/01/24 to respond
with our internal review. We uphold your complaint which was about our
failure to respond within the legal deadline to your original request for
information. You made your request on 12 September 2023, and it was due on
10 October 2023. You requested an internal review on 8 December 2023.
We have breached section 10(1) of the Act by failing to respond to a
request for information promptly and within 20 working days following the
date of receipt of the request. We have also fallen short of the Freedom
of Information Code of Practice under Section 45 which expects internal
reviews to be provided within 20 working days of receipt. We are a small
team, with a large volume of requests.
We initially misread your request and looked for all correspondence with
the Charity Commission. We identified 2,659 items (2.06GB) for the period
1 January 2005 until 12 September 2023. You specified correspondence from
the Charity Commission. We have since retrieved 631 emails. However, this
figure is not complete because it does not cover a previous email address
the CC used during this period.
Several services across the council would be in scope. Correspondence from
the Charity Commission is not held in a single paper or electronic file.
Our files contain our dealings with the CC amongst all the other work we
have done relating to a particular park or entity. We don’t open separate
files simply to deal with correspondence with the CC.
In Legal Services, we have a project currently to identify all of SCC’s
charity holdings. All the deeds for the land in Parks are being studied
and charitable documents logged. This work has so far taken 26 hours 18
minutes.
In Property Services, we have 40,000 records. Charity Commission
correspondence is in the file to which it relates; so, for example,
Bolehill Farm. Our records are on paper and in electronic form.
We therefore must refuse to process this request any further because it
would exceed the “appropriate limit” specified in section 12, which is
£450 or 18 hours of officer time. You could consider refining your request
to come within the cost of compliance. Could you consider narrowing your
request to a particular subject or property or entity for a reasonable
period? Could you make the request of the Charity Commission itself, which
may have their correspondence organised differently, i.e., by Trustee,
which would be Sheffield City Council.
We are happy to otherwise consider a new request for information which
will strive to complete within the deadline.
If you are unhappy with the outcome of this internal review, you can ask
the Information Commissioner for a decision: [1][
email address
]
Kind regards
